definition:
To put off till to-morrow, or from day to day; to defer; to postpone; to delay; as, to procrastinate repentance. Dr. H. More. Hopeless and helpless Ã†geon wend, But to procrastinate his lifeless end. Shak. Syn. -- To postpone; adjourn; defer; delay; retard; protract; prolong.

To delay; to be dilatory. I procrastinate more than I did twenty years ago. Swift.
